revised_title: Coral Growth and Sediment Accumulation Rates on an Atlantic Cable
tldr: The author studied coral growth and sediment accumulation rates on an Atlantic cable that was laid in 1870 and recovered in 1876. They found that the coral growth was rapid, while the accumulation of foraminiferal deposits was slow. The study also revealed variations and abnormalities in the structure of the corals, which may have implications for understanding ancient and recent coral faunas.
